channel.title: Vpsland cant host RSPS anymore? (Atleast port 43594)
channel.description:
Hello, I saw on R-S some1 posted this:
Hello, Do you need 43594 port for UDP or TCP application? As, due to a recent recurring issue we have been having with UDP floods, we have disabled these UDP ports inbound. This is part of our new security policy. Thanks, Gary VPSLAND.com Support
Does that means they dont host port 43594 anymore? So i only have to change port 5555? [b]DO NOT SPAM WRONG BOARD WHERE ELSE TO POST I, GIVE ME A IDEA THEN WHEN YOU START SPAM/FLAME.[/b] ,Thanks

item.title: Vpsland cant host RSPS anymore? (Atleast port 43594)
item.dc:creator: @Duch-PRO Duch-PRO
item.description:
@Duch-PRO wrote:

Tree_Climber:

I’m pretty sure rs servers use tcp

they need both TCP and UDP,
43594 is no longer an option with VPSland.
5555 is not a problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Vpsland cant host RSPS anymore? (Atleast port 43594)
item.dc:creator: @Fight247 Fight247
item.description:
@Fight247 wrote:

Hello,

I saw on R-S some1 posted this:

Hello,

Do you need 43594 port for UDP or TCP application? As, due to a recent recurring issue we have been having with UDP floods, we have disabled these UDP ports inbound. This is part of our new security policy.
Thanks,

Gary
VPSLAND.com Support

Does that means they dont host port 43594 anymore?
So i only have to change port 5555?

DO NOT SPAM WRONG BOARD WHERE ELSE TO POST I, GIVE ME A IDEA THEN WHEN YOU START SPAM/FLAME.

,Thanks

Read full topic
